alert.note: Alert for Northern Tangipahoa; St. Helena; Washington (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 08 at 4:20PM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern St. Helena, northwestern Tangipahoa and western Washington Parishes, Pike and Amite Counties through 515 PM CST... At 419 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles west of Smithdale to Darlington. Movement was northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Mccomb, Liberty, Greensburg, Magnolia, Kentwood, Summit, Osyka, Smithdale, Darlington, Gillsburg, Easleyville, Tangipahoa and Mccomb Airport. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 55 in Louisiana between mile markers 57 and 66. Interstate 55 in Mississippi between mile markers 1 and 24. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall and frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building or vehicle.
